events.name: SQSIZE
events.comment: X and Y dimensions of the squares

children.text: Set initial state of the game.
Start GameLogic flowchart.
When the player taps the screen while the tutorial is up, hide the tutorial and start the game.
Reset layout and variables when ResetButton is tapped.
Drop the piece.

children.name: goToX
children.comment: Piece tries to go to this X position

children.name: goToY
children.comment: Piece tries to go to this Y position

children.text: Compute goToX and goToY according to piece's absolution position values.
Check if piece can go to the square.

actions.text: Subtract one move and update text box.

children.text: If it's a pawn and it's reached the top square, open promotion window.
Process game logic.
If it cannot go to the wanted square, send it back to where it was before.
Start dragging the piece.
Show available positions in the board.
Pieces Z-Ordering
Promote pawn to a bigger piece.

children.functionDescription: Promote pawn to a bigger piece

children.text: Control promote screen opacity and game blur according to PromoteOpacity tween.
Promote pawn to tapped piece.

actions.text: Shrink true piece and move "promotion" piece on top of it.
Set true piece animation and scale to match promotion piece visual properties.

children.text: Process game logic following the flowchart.

children.functionDescription: Process game logic following the flowchart

children.text: Run flowchart until it reaches an End or Proceed node

Verify if current white piece can checkmate. That is:
- It exists
- It is a Pawn (which can be promoted), a Rook or a Queen.

Verify if Black King is in check. In this scenario, only 3 pieces can perform a check: Pawn, Rook or Queen.
It is impossible to reach a check state through a knight or bishop, since having one of those pieces immediately leads to a draw due to insufficient materials.
Attacked by Pawn.
Attacked by Rook.
Attacked by Queen.
Not attacked.
Verify which move will be performed by the Black King (if any).
Black King can take White's piece. This will lead to a draw due to insufficient material.

parameters.value:
(distance(BlackKing.posX, BlackKing.posY, WhitePiece.posX, WhitePiece.posY) <= sqrt(2)) &
(distance(WhiteKing.posX, WhiteKing.posY, WhitePiece.posX, WhitePiece.posY) > sqrt(2))

children.text: Black King cannot take White's piece. This may lead to a normal move, stalemate or checkmate.
Black King has available squares to move.
Black King does not have an available square to move.

If the Black King cannot take a piece, but can still move, the following logic should be followed:
- If the White Piece is a pawn, move the Black King closer to it, with the intention of taking it.
- Otherwise, move the Black King to the center. This is a very rudimentary way to defend against getting cornered and checkmated.
Piece is a pawn.
Piece is not a pawn.
Verify if 50 moves have passed. IF that's the case, it's a draw, otherwise keep playing.
50 moves reached.
50 moves not reached.
Black King makes a move.
Take White Pece.
Move closer to White Piece.
Move closer to the center of the board.
End game state reached.
Wait for player's next move.
Show end game message.

actions.text: Show the promotion screen and set text message accordingly.

children.text: Control promote screen opacity and game blur according to PromoteOpacity tween.
